bill_title: require that notice be provided to persons informing them of the expiration date and related information concerning their driver licenses.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require that notice be provided to persons informing them of the expiration date and related information concerning their driver licenses. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-12 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Department of Public Safety shall notify each person who has been issued a driver license pursuant to this title of the license's expiration date. The notification shall be sent by mail at least ninety days, but not more than one hundred twenty days, before the expiration date. The notification shall include the following: (1) A listing and explanation of the documentation and any alternative documents that are required in order to renew the license; and (2) A listing of the three driver license offices located nearest to the license holder's residence address where the license may be renewed, including the address of the offices, the times when the offices are open for business, and the times when licenses may be renewed and any required testing may be conducted. 180 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.063 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
